subject: Re: [junit] call order on test methods
msgSnippet: ... If you absolutely need tests to execute in a certain order, use OrderedTestSuite from GSBase (gsbase.sourceforge.net) to set that order, then look for ways
messageBody:
Daniel wrote:

> On Tue, 10 Aug 2004 22:18:01 -0000, Claude <sesamus@...> wrote:
>
> > Hi,
> > I am using Junit 3.8.1 with WSAD 5.1
> > On some workstation the test methods are called in a wrong order, i.e
> > the last method of the test class is called first a.s.o. up to the
> > beginning of the class.
> > Did anybody already get this strange behavior?
> > Is there a way, to define a parameter for that or is that a known bug?
> > Thanks.
> >
> >
>
> This isnt a bug.
> One important property of any test is that they must be isolated, so junit
> doesn't enforce
> any order.
>
> You should rethink your tests, because they never have to depend on the
> order of execution.

If you absolutely need tests to execute in a certain order, use
OrderedTestSuite from GSBase (gsbase.sourceforge.net) to set that order,
then look for ways to remove the need for your tests to run in a given
order.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
